title: What is the significance of mutual gaze and eye contact in communication?
first_phrase: This text explores the power of communication beyond words. It highlights the physiological aspect of mutual gaze and how it can cause reactions in the body. It also shows how eye contact is linked to dominance during a conversation. It references the works of several individuals such as Allan Mazur, Eugene Rosa, Leonard Zunin, and Virgilio. The text also mentions the historical belief in the power of the voice and eyes to captivate and even kill, as noted by ancient writers Hippocrat, Dioscorides, J Theophrastus, and Plinio.

last_phrase: In conclusion, although the concept of hypnosis has been debated for centuries, there are still many mysteries surrounding it. However, the practical applications of hypnotic techniques for therapeutic and personal use cannot be denied, as evidenced by historical accounts and modern videos showing the effectiveness of hypnosis in relieving pain and other ailments.
